text:
How are theme devs getting around the "This theme requires access to the CTA tool." when customers are on HubSpot starter?
2 different themes or just not using CTA's in modules and adding them in Rich Text when needed.

During HubSpot's first Theme Accelerator program one of the requirements given to us was to use custom coded buttons instead of CTAs so I imagine that's what would be preferred. Not to mention HubSpot CTAs load hecka slow so custom coded is better on page speed.
Hey <@UTS5PEGF6>, <@U39DT5YFL>â€™s suggestion above for using a custom coded button module above would help solve for this. I will make sure to surface this with some internal folks as well on this.
We have 2 different themes. Kinda a pain to maintain both, but :shrug::skin-tone-2:
Hi, the page editor does not show the style options of the custom modules. Is this happening for anyone else?
Hey Bernardo, do you have style fields configured for those modules? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/style-fields-opt-in-beta>
Hi, <@UE5D6CXPA> I am facing this issue too. Most of the style options of the custom modules do not show in the page editor.
Hi ,<@U013PPTC18S> I think it's a general problem, in the custom modules of HubSpot's default themes they still show blank.

Hello all!!! I am facing a very unusual issue. The style options of my custom modules do not show in the page editor- cases where a group is inside a group(Screenshots attached). Can anyone help me with it?
Yeah, Hope it gets resolved soon
